diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Invasive ductal carcinoma of the breast with isolated tumor cells in a sentinel lymph node (T1b pN0 (i+))
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by imaging findings of an irregular mass with calcifications, core biopsy revealing infiltrating ductal carcinoma (grade 2 of 3), and histopathological examination confirming metastatic tumor cells in the sentinel lymph node without extracapsular extension. The tumor was positive for estrogen-receptor protein, and no vascular invasion was noted.
